\s1\ql \li0\ri0\keepn\nowidctlpar\faauto\outlinelevel0\rin0\lin0\itap0 \b\fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par Facility:\tab  Quality Ag Services of Iowa, Inc.; Melrose, IA

\par Contact:\tab  Todd Ryan

\par Phone:  641-726-3210

\par }{\b\fs20 

\par {\pntext\pard\plain\b\fs20 \hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 1.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\tx720{\*\pn \pnlvlbody\ilvl0\ls1\pnrnot0\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxta .}}\faauto\ls1\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\b\fs20 Facility Policy.

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl12\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\faauto\ilvl12\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl12\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\faauto\ilvl12\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 The owners, management and employees of Quality Ag Services of Iowa, Inc., Melrose, IA, are comm

itted to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to 

the people and the environment.  

\par }{\b\fs20 

\par {\pntext\pard\plain\b\fs20 \hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 2.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\tx720{\*\pn \pnlvlbody\ilvl0\ls1\pnrnot0\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxta .}}\faauto\ls1\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\b\fs20 Facility Information.

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 

The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct app

lication for crop production nutrients. The

 maximum quantity stored would be about 177,700 pounds; including 1 \endash  12,000 gallon storage tank; 1 \endash  6,000 gallon storage tank; and 23 \endash  1,000 gallon nurse tanks. 

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 3.\tab Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s15\ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 a.\tab The worst-case scenario would be

 the release of the total contents of a storage tank released as gas over a period of 10 minutes.  The maximum quantity released would be 52,000 pounds, which represents the volume of the largest storage tank (12,000 gallons) at 85 percent capacity as lim

ited by design standards.  The distance to the end point (point of dispersion to 200 parts per million, or ppm) is about 1.8 miles.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s15\ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 b.\tab 

The alternate release scenario, based on the five-year accident history (or the most likely potential incident), is a r

elease from a break in a 3-inch transfer hose followed by release of ammonia for 2 minutes before an automatic or manual shut-off intervenes and stops the flow of ammonia.  The maximum quantity released would be 26,640 pounds.  The distance to the endpoin

t (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is about 1.60 miles.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\b\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 4.\tab Accidental Release Prevention Program

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720

\itap0 {\fs20 The facility has been reviewed for general compliance with the provisions of \'93Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1\'94

, published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. (ANSI), and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, \'93Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia\'94

.  The ANSI Standard has been adopted by reference by Iowa Administrative Code Part 21\endash Chapter 43\endash 

Rule 43.6(200)-Standard for the Storage and  Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in the Registration Form Section 8.3.b.

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 5.\tab Five-Year Accident History.\tab \tab 

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s16\ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 There have been

 no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, 

property damage, or environmental damage.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \fi720\li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 6.\tab Emergency Response Program.

\par }{\fs20 

\par \tab The facility has:

\par 

\par {\listtext\pard\plain\fs20 \hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 a.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\jclisttab\tx1440\faauto\ls2\rin0\lin1440\itap0 {\fs20 a written Emergency Action Plan (EAP), in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38; and   



\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 {\fs20 b.\tab provided state and local a

uthorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \fi720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 \tab 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 7.\tab Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of saf

e conditions.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of\tab anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.

\par }}
